text: Hey everyone, I accidentally uploaded a folder outside of my theme folder. It’s pretty large so I’m hesitant to move it. I think I know the answer, but can I reference the contents of that folder within my theme?

If it contains modules or templates, it will make it messy on the front end because they wouldn’t be in the theme. If it’s just assets such as images, css, js, fonts etc it shouldn’t matter being outside the theme folder.

However I think you should be able to move it  without worrying too much unless there are already cross references that could break.

Hello! I have configured my development site recently. I want this domain to utilise a separate theme folder. I would check the code, test the code flow and then I will move my code to production. This dev theme folder should not affect / touch the theme files which is being utilised by my production site. Can anyone help me on this? Thanks!!

Hi, @everyone!
I create a *child theme* of *Customer Portal* to personalize the *footer modules*. But I can't find where we can select this child theme? Is it possible?

I've a client using Neambo Act21. The last few days when they try to edit global content the edit window won't load. The loading circle in the left edit panel just spins forever.

The console is showing the following error:
Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'content')
    at contentTransformUtils.js:224:68
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at sA (contentTransformUtils.js:221:24)
    at lA (contentTransformUtils.js:256:12)
    at dA (contentTransformUtils.js:316:46)
    at InitialRequestActions.js:23:8
    at nrWrapper (VM69 editor:55:29524)

Any ideas on if this is related?
